text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with fresh peach tartlets i'm going
to show you how to make this it's so
easy and it looks like it came from a
fancy French pastry shop so here we go
we're going to take some fresh peaches
take a knife cut carefully down you're
going to hit the stone or the pit you
give it a twist and then just pull the
pit out and then I'm going to cut each
half into four pieces so out of each
peach you will get eight pieces you
didn't know this was going to be a math
demo also and yes I can see a couple of
the peaches had little bruise marks
which is why I wanted to use them up for
this tart so it's totally fine if it's
not absolutely perfect fruit all right
so my peaches are cut I also have some
white sugar and the secret ingredient
ancient Chinese secret which is Chinese
five-spice which gives it a really
unique exotic delicious flavor so we're
going to take some butter in a pan and
as soon as it foams up I have this on
medium heat as soon as it foams up I'm
going to throw in my fresh peaches I'm
going to even them out alright once all
the peaches are flat and they're
sizzling away in the butter over medium
heat I'm going to pour over my sugar in
five spice mixture and this is going to
take about two minutes but the sugar is
going to melt and then it's going to
slowly start to caramelize you want to
turn the peaches maybe once so that they
cook on each side and as soon as you
flip all those peaches over by that time
about a minute and a half will have gone
by the sugar will be almost caramelized
and then it'll look like that so it's
bubbly it's getting kind of a tan color
take it off the heat throw it in a bowl
and reserve so you want that to cool -
basically room temperature before you
work with it
all right if you try to grab that too
soon serious third-degree peach burns
which are no fun so don't touch the
peach until it cools little I have pie
crust you can make your own you can use
store-bought I don't judge you I'm just
going to make a couple here just to demo
this but out of one of those pie crust
sheets you'll get four of these tarts
that's like a four and a half inch mold
I'm going to do this on a silicone
baking mat just you know makes life
easier and this is so simple take your
finger and go around and just fold up
the edges like I don't know maybe a half
inch 3/8 all the way around that's it
and that just forms like a little rim
around it and you'll see what that does
I'm going to brush it with the egg wash
that's just a beaten egg with a couple
drops of water in it now into the center
of each tartlet I'm going to put one
slice of peach that way one slice of
peach the opposite way and then watch
this one peach slice right in the middle
look at that so fancy yet so simple
alright drizzle a little bit of that
peach SERP it's got that amazing
five-spice in it so aromatic that goes
in a 375-degree oven for 15 minutes and
look what comes out peach tartlet
alright don't worry if a little bit of
the juice spills over it's all part of
the show let those cool before you eat
them they get crunchy chewy peachy
unbelievable alright so it's summer
there's peaches all over the place buy
some fresh peaches and make this
beautiful fresh peach tartlet if you're
scared of Chinese five-spice which you
know I don't know why you would be but
you can just substitute a little bit of
cinnamon and maybe a little bit of
ground ginger but to try the five-spice
it's got a little bit of pepper in it
and a really really unique nice flavour
for peaches anyway check out the site
all the ingredients are there really
super simple recipe I hope you give it a
try and as always enjoy
[Music]
